trans-unit.source: Logging for Machine Learning web services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Logging for Machine Learning web services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to enable logging for Machine Learning web services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to enable logging for Machine Learning web services.

trans-unit.source: Logging provides additional information to help troubleshoot the APIs.
trans-unit.target: Logging provides additional information to help troubleshoot the APIs.

trans-unit.source: Enable logging for Machine Learning web services
trans-unit.target: Enable logging for Machine Learning web services

trans-unit.source: This document provides information on the logging capability of Azure ML Web Services.
trans-unit.target: This document provides information on the logging capability of Azure ML Web Services.

trans-unit.source: Enabling logging in web services provides additional information to help troubleshoot the APIs beyond just and error number and a message.
trans-unit.target: Enabling logging in web services provides additional information to help troubleshoot the APIs beyond just and error number and a message.

trans-unit.source: How to enable logging in Web Services:
trans-unit.target: How to enable logging in Web Services:

trans-unit.source: To enable logging, you need to access the Web Service Dashboard from the Azure Portal, then click to enable it by clicking on the Yes button then clicking on Save.
trans-unit.target: To enable logging, you need to access the Web Service Dashboard from the Azure Portal, then click to enable it by clicking on the Yes button then clicking on Save.

trans-unit.source: What is the effect of enabling logging:
trans-unit.target: What is the effect of enabling logging:

trans-unit.source: When Logging is enabled, all the diagnostics/errors from the default endpoint are logged to the Azure Storage Account linked with the user’s workspace.
trans-unit.target: When Logging is enabled, all the diagnostics/errors from the default endpoint are logged to the Azure Storage Account linked with the user’s workspace.

trans-unit.source: You can see this storage account in the Azure portal Dashboard view (bottom of the Quick Glance section) of their workspace.
trans-unit.target: You can see this storage account in the Azure portal Dashboard view (bottom of the Quick Glance section) of their workspace.

trans-unit.source: Where is it available:
trans-unit.target: Where is it available:

trans-unit.source: We enable Logging for the Web Service’s default endpoint currently.
trans-unit.target: We enable Logging for the Web Service’s default endpoint currently.

trans-unit.source: We will soon be offering this feature for the additional endpoints that the user can create in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: We will soon be offering this feature for the additional endpoints that the user can create in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: How to view the logs:
trans-unit.target: How to view the logs:

trans-unit.source: The logs can be viewed using any of the several tools available to ‘explore’ an Azure Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: The logs can be viewed using any of the several tools available to ‘explore’ an Azure Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: The easiest may be to simply navigate to the Storage Account in the Azure portal and then click on the CONTAINERS tab.
trans-unit.target: The easiest may be to simply navigate to the Storage Account in the Azure portal and then click on the CONTAINERS tab.

trans-unit.source: You would then see a Container named **ml-diagnostics**.
trans-unit.target: You would then see a Container named **ml-diagnostics**.

trans-unit.source: This container holds all the diagnostics info for all the web service endpoints for all the workspaces associated with this Storage account.
trans-unit.target: This container holds all the diagnostics info for all the web service endpoints for all the workspaces associated with this Storage account.

trans-unit.source: What are the log blob details:
trans-unit.target: What are the log blob details:

trans-unit.source: Each blob in the container holds the diagnostics info for exactly one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Each blob in the container holds the diagnostics info for exactly one of the following:

trans-unit.source: An execution of the Batch-Execution method
trans-unit.target: An execution of the Batch-Execution method

trans-unit.source: An execution of the Request-Response method
trans-unit.target: An execution of the Request-Response method

trans-unit.source: Initialization of a Request-Response container
trans-unit.target: Initialization of a Request-Response container

trans-unit.source: The name of each blob has a prefix of the following form: {Workspace Id}-{Web service Id}-{Endpoint Id}/{Log type}
trans-unit.target: The name of each blob has a prefix of the following form: {Workspace Id}-{Web service Id}-{Endpoint Id}/{Log type}

trans-unit.source: Log type takes one of the following values:
trans-unit.target: Log type takes one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: batch
trans-unit.target: batch

trans-unit.source: score/requests
trans-unit.target: score/requests

trans-unit.source: score/init
trans-unit.target: score/init

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
